title: Wormholes could be hidden near the Milky Way's supermassive black hole
text:
Wormholes are often found in science fiction but have not yet been proven to exist (Image: Getty)

Mysterious ‘wormholes’ leading to other dimensions could be lurking near the monstrous supermassive black hole at the centre of our galaxy.

The Milky Way’s dark core is believed to be dominated by a beast called Sagittarius A* that’s more than 40 million kilometres wide.

Now a team of scientists has suggested looking for wormholes near the cosmic colossus, because these portals are expected to form only in ‘extreme gravitational conditions, such as those present at supermassive black holes’.

We’ve never actually discovered a wormhole or even proven they exist, although they have featured in countless science fiction films and stories.

But some experts believe they could be doorways to alternate realities or faraway regions of our own universe.

In a new paper, scientists have said that a wormhole could be detectable because stars at the hole’s end would influence those on our side of its entrance.

This means it would be possible to detect the presence of a wormhole by searching for ‘small deviations’ in the orbit of stars near Sagittarius A*.

The anatomy of a supermassive black hole (Image: Nasa)

‘If you have two stars, one on each side of the wormhole, the star on our side should feel the gravitational influence of the star that’s on the other side. The gravitational flux will go through the wormhole,’ said Dejan Stojkovic, PhD, cosmologist and professor of physics in the University at Buffalo College of Arts and Sciences.

‘So if you map the expected orbit of a star around Sagittarius A*, you should see deviations from that orbit if there is a wormhole there with a star on the other side.’

However, even if we find a wormhole there’s no guarantee we could simply jump into it and speed through into an alien universe.

‘Even if a wormhole is traversable, people and spaceships most likely aren’t going to be passing through,’ Stojkovic added.

‘Realistically, you would need a source of negative energy to keep the wormhole open, and we don’t know how to do that. To create a huge wormhole that’s stable, you need some magic.’
description: Dark beast at the centre of our galaxy may be accompanied by 'wormholes' leading to alternate realities.
